Class Employee

java.lang.Object
Documents.Employee
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable
public class Employee extends Object implements Serializable
An instantiable class which defines an Employee.

  • Constructor Details

    • Employee

      public Employee()
      Employee no-argument constructor. Calls the 2-argument Employee constructor to initialise the attributes of Employee object with some default initial values to leave the Employee object in a consistent initial state

    • Employee

      public Employee(String firstName, String lastName)
      Employee 2-argument constructor. Calls the 3 mutators and the incrementCount() method to initialise the attributes of an Employee object with some user-supplied values. The Staff ID is set internally using the value of the count attribute, to ensure a unique Staff ID values.
      Parameters:
      firstName - the first name of employee
      lastName - the last name of employee

  • Method Details

    • incrementCount

      public static void incrementCount()
      Method to increment the static count attribute of the class, this is to ensure that every Employee object will have a unique ID value, as it tracks the value of this attribute

    • getStaffID

      public int getStaffID()
      Method to get the value of the static count attribute
      Returns:
      an integer value specifying the current value of the count attribute
